reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having purchased this a few version ago, I've watched it grow a little. The game has got alot of potential; but right now it's deep in devlopment. Don't come in expecting too much currently; the game is super barebones. The premise is simple enough; Dropped into a random world naked, alone and vulnerable. Mine your way to house, to a farm, to safety. Right now you can make pretty detailed looking houses, but inside it's pretty sparce; the underground sections offer up spice to the gameplay, and the many bees that attack during the day add somewhat of a challenge.

I'll be updating this review as dev goes on. Right now, I feel it's worth the price, especially since Multiplayer is coming at some point. Pick this up if you're looking for a fun SP experience (Albeit with little to do) or for a future MP game. It's an investment for a quality product!

You can punch bees, as far as I care, This game gets Game Of The Year!

In all seriousness though, this game is good, however it is very basic at this moment because it is in EARLY access, but with its current pricetag I say it's worth it! It's just 5 dollers at this moment! So why not give it a try?
Edit:There has been an EXTREME lack of updates, like the first update I remember, was when it released on steam, I recommend people be very careful before buying this as a result.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

[Edit: added video review]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xryrG0-lzXE

I like what I see so far of this little RPG Maker-meets-Minecraft, if you will. It's early, but functional. I'm impressed with proposed graphics for it.

Only my opinion, but I think there's oodles of potential in a builder game that looks like an old-school 2D RPG, especially if multiplayer is being added, the graphics look like traditional, Japanese RPGs.

I see the potential for a host of possibilities, including appealing to an audience that loves old RPG artwork, by including countless craftable items, clothes, furniture and more.

Not too mention if the possibility of modding is ever introduced in a way, say, Minecraft is moddable. That would expand the appeal tremendously if you can start including functional pipes, oil, engines and the like, similar to the way modding has blown-up around other building games.

Or add a little bit of Terraria progression by having multiple underground levels, each increasingly difficult with better ore and items to get.

This base framework functions and embarrassing or not, I've blown 7 hours just chopping trees and digging so far in its current state.

I look forward to the possibility of more varied terrain, better graphics, and lots and lots more items and activities to take part it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before I say anything, I want to point out that the ONE thing this game NEEDS to be GREAT IS...

nothing lol NO BUT FOR REAL
IT
IS
Steam Workshop. This would add a lot of potential that the dev can't fulfill all the time. Just a thought doe. Anyways, to the review!

Okay, so I haven't ever seen an upstarter game that I ever thought could I have potential besides Terraria, but this does. This has a LOT of potential. But unless the developer works soon, it may not see it. What it needs is more ores, and more levels of mining. Not just one, it has to have at least 10 levels, and the bottom level be some kind of underworld. It needs a lot more ores, biomes, etc. There is also a rare glitch where sometimes when you spawn, you're in the middle of the ocean... yeah, that sucks. But Multiplayer will SERIOUSLY add awesomeness to the max. But, there needs to be things to make multiplayer become mainstream. #1, the developer needs to look at Minecraft for inspiration. Famous servers in MC have things in common, Texture packs, custom named items/potions, and redstone contraptions. This game needs these three things to become, well, AWESOMER THAN POSSIBLE! Well... in my opinion :3

Now then, there needs to be an elevation system too. Jumping higher and higher, bla bla bla. This can add some amazing builds, and cool land features. A minimap would be nice too. Sprint ability is a must. But yeah, I realize this is Early Access, so what am I saying anyways? XD

Point is, if you have the money, GET THIS GAME. This game needs it, it will become great but remember that what this dev needs is money. Thanks for reading B-T-Dubz, :P :D

edit: Just read over my review... I realized I stumble on and on when I write XD

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWorst game ever. I bought this a while ago and while it was okay at first in it's early stages, I recently came back to it as it was update and was sure to be better. I was wrong. It crashes a lot and you lose your progress and the things you collected, The files don't work right and you have to work around things just to open the game. I'm going to hold out in hopes that this game will recieve updates in the future that will fix all the problems, but I would not hold my breath. Don't waste your money.
